intro: Swainsona sejuncta, commonly known as the desert false nettle, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in rocky soils and can withstand drought conditions. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by bean-like pods containing seeds. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate to elliptic, and have a slightly hairy texture. Swainsona sejuncta is adapted to survive in harsh environments, making it an important component of its native ecosystem.
